title: In Cameroon, an insect helps fishermen combat an invasive fern
description: Weevils have been introduced into Lake Ossa to combat the proliferation of 'Salvinia molesta,' an aquatic fern threatening the survival of marine mammals.

title: US gymnast Simone Biles secures 21st world title
description: Less than three months after returning to competition, the American superstar is back at the top of world gymnastics once again.

title: Rugby World Cup: France dismantles Italy 60-7 to secure quarter-final qualification
description: Finishing atop Pool A, France is now set to face the defending champion, South Africa, in what promises to be an exciting quarterfinal clash next weekend.

title: China's property developers, awash in inventory, will do anything to sell apartments and houses
description: In order to circumvent regulations prohibiting price reductions, Chinese developers are offering gifts ranging from electric kettles and cars to gold bars.

title: France closes seven schools due to bedbug infestation
description: French Education Minister Gabriel Attal called for 'an immediate response' in order to have 'institutions treated within 24 hours.'

title: 18 migrants killed in Mexico bus crash
description: The dead, three of them minors, were from Venezuela and Haiti, according to a statement from the prosecutor's office in Oaxaca state.

title: 'During the Yom Kippur War, the "oil weapon" was used successfully for the first time'
description: The Yom Kippur War caused a major energy shock but failed to raise global awareness of the need to replace oil, writes economist Michel Lepetit.

title: Over 500 migrants arrive on Spain's Canary Islands
description: They have come over the past 24 hours in six large wooden boats after traversing the perilous Atlantic route from West Africa.

title: 2023 Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi honored for fight against oppression of Iranian women
description: The 51-year-old activist and journalist, who sacrificed everything to continue her struggle in Iran, is rewarded 'her fight against the oppression of women in Iran and her fight to promote human rights and freedom for all.'

title: Tunisian opposition politician Abir Moussi lumped 'together with the Islamists'
description: The former MP, a harsh critic of the Ennahda party that is nostalgic for the Ben Ali regime, has been arrested. She is accused of 'an attack aimed at changing the form of government.'

title: How Morocco became co-host of the 2030 FIFA World Cup
description: After multiple bids to host the World Cup, the kingdom's candidacy alongside Spain and Portugal was helped by the good relations between the three countries.

title: French ex-president Sarkozy charged over possible witness tampering
description: Sarkozy has been charged with 'concealment of witness tampering' and 'participation in a criminal conspiracy to commit the offense of organized fraud.'

title: Algeria begins anti-bedbug campaign amid French panic
description: The preventative measures come amid a surge of reported sightings in France, home to a large Algerian diaspora.

title: UK judge throws out harassment case against Spain's former king
description: Danish businesswoman Corinna zu Sayn-Wittgenstein-Sayn had sued Juan Carlos, who abdicated in 2014. She wanted damages for personal injury.

title: Rugby World Cup: Lucu's big night filling Dupont's shoes as France take on Italy in crucial decider
description: In France's important match against Italy on Friday, the Bordeaux scrum-half will have the onerous task of standing in for the French national team's injured captain. It's a situation that he is very familiar with.

title: German discount giants Aldi and Lidl buoyed by inflation and changing consumer habits
description: The two discount champions are gaining market share, particularly in the United States and the United Kingdom. But the race for size is weighing on profits.

title: Sub-Saharan Africa set for 'stronger voice' at IMF: Georgieva
description: The IMF chief said Sub-Saharan Africa will get a third seat on the global lender's executive board.

title: French real estate has reached a crisis but not yet a crash
description: After years of boom, the property market is now experiencing a sharp downturn in transactions, due to the rise in lending rates, as well as the beginnings of a decline in prices.

title: European doubt in US support for Ukraine on display during summit in Granada
description: The current crisis in Washington only serves to aid 'Russia and other enemies to our way of life who want to ride such political storms' said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky following the US Congress' failure to approve the latest aid package to Kyiv.

title: Fabien Galthié in Le Monde, from rebel scrum-half to esteemed coach for the French national team
description: After defeating New Zealand, the French rugby team has kept an unbroken winning streak ahead of their crucial match against Italy on Friday and their coach has played a major role. Le Monde has been following his lifetime of rugby since June 13, 1991.

title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Iranian women's rights campaigner Narges Mohammadi
description: The imprisoned Iranian activist was named as the recipient of the 2023 Nobel Peace Prize on Friday 'for her fight against the oppression of women in Iran and her fight to promote human rights and freedom for all.'

title: Covid-19 monitoring integrated into French wastewater treatment process
description: From the beginning of the pandemic, researchers have been exploring the possibility of tracking the circulation of SARS-CoV-2 based on the presence of the virus in human feces, and therefore in wastewater. France was one of the pioneers in this field.

title: In Rio de Janeiro, jackfruits threaten both cyclists and biodiversity
description: The jackfruit, known for its tough skin covered with small spikes, can weigh up to 30 kg. Considered an 'invasive species,' the tree in which it grows is proliferating in the Brazilian city.

title: Fukushima water discharge: Local businesses will receive compensation for damage to reputation
description: As of Monday, the plant operator Tepco has been accepting claims for compensation from the fishing industry, whose image has been particularly affected by the official discharge of treated and diluted water from the nuclear power plant.

title: How Ukraine is dealing with the reality of a long war
description: The first phase of the conflict was marked by so many unexpected jolts that it defied the rhythm of the conventional war Ukraine is now facing.

title: 'Lupin' Part 3 on Netflix: The indolence of the gentleman burglar
description: Assane Diop's cat-and-mouse game with the law continues but with a sense of familiarity.

title: For this Rugby World Cup, the French national team goes all out to charm the crowds
description: In 2007, during the first World Cup held in France, Les Bleus hunkered down in their base camp. Sixteen years later, they are now crisscrossing the country, happily getting up close and personal with fans.

title: Venezuela issues arrest warrant for opposition leader Juan Guaido
description: Exiled in the United States, the former president of the National Assembly proclaimed himself 'interim president' in January 2019 after the contested re-election of Nicolas Maduro in 2018. He faces notable charges of treason and usurpation of office.

title: The French army has begun its withdrawal from Niger
description: The Ministry of the Armed Forces has announced that about 1,500 troops will be withdrawn starting 'this week' and be completed 'by the end of the year.' This departure is taking place against a backdrop of continuing tension with the coup leaders in Niger.

title: US to resume deportation flights to Venezuela
description: The Biden administration is set to recommence deportations of Venezuelan migrants, the largest group encountered at the US-Mexico border last month, as their numbers continue to increase amidst economic challenges in their home country.

title: 'The international order born in 1945 is obsolete. But proposals to amend or replace it are not rushing in'
description: The growing number of players on the international scene would require rules of the game to exist, now more than ever. Alain Franchon observes that the opposite trend is currently unfolding.
